citation.biblCit: Odynak, David; Russell, Fran, 2015, "University of Alberta Graduand Survey, 1994", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10607, UAL Dataverse, V2

stdyInfo.abstract: The 1994 Graduand Survey was undertaken to assist the University of Alberta in its on-going efforts to improve the quality of education received by students. most of the 1994 survey questions were repeated from the 1992 and 1993 Graduand Surveys, since a primary goal of these 'exit surveys' is to develop an over-time data base that will allow a systematic monitoring of the University's efforts to achieve its teaching goals.

sumDscr.geogCover: Alberta, City of Edmonton, University of Alberta
sumDscr.universe: The 1994 survey was conducted in June in conjunction with the University of Alberta's spring Convocation. All students graduating from undergraduate or professional programs were surveyed, and completed questionnaires were received from 1349 graduates (30 percent of those graduating) Respondents appeared to be typical of the population of graduates although women were somewhat more likely to respond. This sampling bias was taken into account by comparing responses by gender.

othrStdyMat.relMat: Krahn, Harvey, and Brian J. Silzer. "A Study Of Exit Surveys: The Graduand Survey At The University Of Alberta." College And University 71.1 (1995): 12-23. ERIC.
